Tucson picks up some speed in the tunnel and remembered that it did work ef=
fectively before.  His increase in speed was from a reasonable thirty miles=
 per hour up to about fifty where he finds that his resilliant armor serves=
 just as well if not better at the task of doubling as a battering ram.  Wi=
th this he attempts to push forward, literally trying to throw his weight a=
round.  His sonar was now picking up a ping in the tunnel. A very familliar=
 ping. 

" Autobots, Maximals, I have a signal bouncing off my sonar detect=
ion systems.  If I didn't know any better, I'd say they're comming from Rod=
imus.  His alloys make a distinctive sound when they bounce off the sonar. =
 I'm picking that up now."

Straight Shot mans a computer inside Tucsons' c=
ab.  She then looks to a radar screen with the object which the waves seem =
to be bouncing off of.  She turns to Perceptor with a look of hope on her f=
ace.

"Perceptor, he's right.  It's Rodimus's signals coming through the ra=
dar. Don't worry, we'll find him, and we'll all be safe and sound as soon a=
s we get everyone out of here."

Quickstride is swift to join Tallon in fir=
ing off a few shots at the insects, and attempts to hit several of them.  A=
ll the while snorting loudly through nostrills.

" I can't wait to get out =
of this roach motel!  Hang in there Talon, I got your back!"
